question:
who sang on the back in black album
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
The "Back in Black" album is one of the most famous rock albums and was released by the Australian rock band AC/DC in 1980. The album is notable for being the first to feature lead singer Brian Johnson after the death of the previous lead singer, Bon Scott. The album includes iconic tracks such as "You Shook Me All Night Long" and "Hells Bells." Given this context, the primary vocalist on the "Back in Black" album is Brian Johnson.

Answer: Brian Johnson sang on the "Back in Black" album.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who sang on the back in black album
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- "Back in Black" (song), a 1981 song by AC/DC\n', '"Back in Black" is a song by AC/DC, appearing as the first track on side two of their 1980 album of the same name.\n', 'Back in Black (song)\n', 'With Johnson the band completed the songwriting that they had begun with Scott for the album "Back in Black". Recording took place at Compass Point Studios in The Bahamas a few months after Scott\'s death. "Back in Black", produced by Mutt Lange and recorded by Tony Platt, became their biggest-selling album and a hard-rock landmark; hits include "Hells Bells", "You Shook Me All Night Long", "Rock and Roll Ain\'t Noise Pollution" and the title track. The album reached No.1 in the UK and No.4 in the US, where it spent 131 weeks on the "Billboard" 200 album chart.\n', 'BULLET::::7. "Back in Black" by AC/DC\n']

Brian Johnson sang on the "Back in Black" album.

The "Back in Black" album is one of the most iconic rock albums in history, released by the Australian rock band AC/DC in 1980. This album is particularly significant as it marks the first appearance of lead singer Brian Johnson following the tragic death of the previous lead singer, Bon Scott. The songwriting for the album was completed with Johnson, which underscores the transition in the band's lineup and the emotional context surrounding its creation.

The album was produced by Mutt Lange and recorded at Compass Point Studios in The Bahamas, which adds depth to its production history. "Back in Black" is not only AC/DC's biggest-selling album but also a landmark in hard rock, achieving notable commercial success by reaching No. 1 in the UK and No. 4 in the US, where it spent an impressive 131 weeks on the Billboard 200 chart.

The album features several iconic tracks, including "You Shook Me All Night Long," "Hells Bells," "Rock and Roll Ain't Noise Pollution," and the title track "Back in Black." These songs have become staples in rock music and contribute to the album's lasting legacy.

Given this context, the primary vocalist on the "Back in Black" album is Brian Johnson, who played a crucial role in the band's evolution during this pivotal time.

**Answer:**
Brian Johnson sang on the "Back in Black" album.

Back in Black (song)
With Johnson the band completed the songwriting that they had begun with Scott for the album "Back in Black". Recording took place at Compass Point Studios in The Bahamas a few months after Scott's death. "Back in Black", produced by Mutt Lange and recorded by Tony Platt, became their biggest-selling album and a hard-rock landmark; hits include "Hells Bells", "You Shook Me All Night Long", "Rock and Roll Ain't Noise Pollution" and the title track. The album reached No.1 in the UK and No.4 in the US, where it spent 131 weeks on the "Billboard" 200 album chart.
